items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Sunday 2 November.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Monday 3 November 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 02 November 2025 . 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the upper Derwent and and Derwent Water. Further rain forecast this evening will cause the river to rise higher and we expect to issue the flood warning for Keswick Campsite on Monday the 03/11/2025. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
